data.name: Pansage
data.flavorText: This Pokémon dwells deep in the forest. Eating a leaf from its head whisks weariness away as if by magic.

data.name: Simisage
data.flavorText: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.

data.name: Sewaddle
data.flavorText: Leavanny dress it in clothes they made for it when it hatched. It hides its head in its hood while it is sleeping.

data.name: Sewaddle
data.flavorText: This Pokémon makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.

data.name: Swadloon
data.flavorText: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.

data.name: Swadloon
data.flavorText: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.

data.name: Leavanny
data.flavorText: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves, using the cutters on its arms and sticky silk.

data.name: Leavanny
data.flavorText: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.

data.name: Cottonee
data.flavorText: They go wherever the wind takes them. On rainy days, their bodies are heavier, so they take shelter beneath big trees.

data.name: Cottonee
data.flavorText: When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from its body. The cotton serves as a decoy to distract the attacker.

data.name: Whimsicott
data.flavorText: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.

data.name: Whimsicott
data.flavorText: Riding whirlwinds, they appear. These Pokémon sneak through gaps into houses and cause all sorts of mischief.

data.name: Petilil
data.flavorText: The leaves on its head are very bitter. Eating one of these leaves is known to refresh a tired body.

data.name: Lilligant
data.flavorText: Even veteran Trainers face a challenge in getting its beautiful flower to bloom. This Pokémon is popular with celebrities.

data.name: Deerling
data.flavorText: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon's fur. People use it to mark the seasons.

data.name: Sawsbuck
data.flavorText: The plants growing on its horns change according to the season. The leaders of the herd possess magnificent horns.

data.name: Virizion
data.flavorText: This Pokémon fought humans in order to protect its friends. Legends about it continue to be passed down.

data.name: Pansear
data.flavorText: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600º F.

data.name: Simisear
data.flavorText: A flame burns inside its body. It scatters embers from its head and tail to sear its opponents.

data.name: Darumaka
data.flavorText: When its internal fire is burning, it cannot calm down and it runs around. When the fire diminishes, it falls asleep.

data.name: Darmanitan
data.flavorText: Its internal fire burns at 2,500º F, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.

data.name: Panpour
data.flavorText: It does not thrive in dry environments. It keeps itself damp by shooting water stored in its head tuft from its tail.

data.name: Simipour
data.flavorText: The tuft on its head holds water. When the level runs low, it replenishes the tuft by siphoning up water with its tail.

data.name: Basculin
data.flavorText: Red and blue Basculin get along so poorly, they'll start fighting instantly. These Pokémon are very hostile.

data.name: Basculin
data.flavorText: Red and blue Basculin usually do not get along, but sometimes members of one school mingle with the other's school.

data.name: Ducklett
data.flavorText: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.

data.name: Swanna
data.flavorText: It administers sharp, powerful pecks with its bill. It whips its long neck to deliver forceful repeated strikes.

data.name: Cubchoo
data.flavorText: When it is not feeling well, its mucus gets watery and the power of its Ice-type moves decreases.

data.name: Cubchoo
data.flavorText: Its nose is always running. It sniffs the snot back up because the mucus provides the raw material for its moves.

data.name: Beartic
data.flavorText: It can make its breath freeze at will. Very able in the water, it swims around in northern seas and catches prey.

data.name: Beartic
data.flavorText: It freezes its breath to create fangs and claws of ice to fight with. Cold northern areas are its habitat.

data.name: Emolga
data.flavorText: The energy made in its cheeks' electric pouches is stored inside its membranes and released while it is gliding.

data.name: Joltik
data.flavorText: Joltik that live in cities have learned a technique for sucking electricity from the outlets in houses.

data.name: Galvantula
data.flavorText: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.

data.name: Thundurus
data.flavorText: The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.

data.name: Woobat
data.flavorText: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.

data.name: Swoobat
data.flavorText: Anyone who comes into contact with the ultrasonic waves emitted by a courting male experiences a positive mood shift.

data.name: Venipede
data.flavorText: It discovers what is going on around it by using the feelers on its head and tail. It is brutally aggressive.

data.name: Whirlipede
data.flavorText: It is usually motionless, but when attacked, it rotates at high speed and then crashes into its opponent.

data.name: Scolipede
data.flavorText: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.

data.name: Sigilyph
data.flavorText: The guardians of an ancient city, they use their psychic power to attack enemies that invade their territory.

data.name: Sigilyph
data.flavorText: They never vary the route they fly, because their memories of guarding an ancient city remain steadfast.

data.name: Gothita
data.flavorText: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.

data.name: Gothita
data.flavorText: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only Gothita can see.

data.name: Gothorita
data.flavorText: They use hypnosis to control people and Pokémon. Tales of Gothorita leading people astray are told in every corner.

data.name: Gothorita
data.flavorText: Starlight is the source of their power. At night, they mark star positions by using psychic power to float stones.

data.name: Gothitelle
data.flavorText: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.

data.name: Gothitelle
data.flavorText: They can predict the future from the placement and movement of the stars. They can see Trainers' life spans.

data.name: Roggenrola
data.flavorText: Its ear is hexagonal in shape. Compressed underground, its body is as hard as steel.

data.name: Roggenrola
data.flavorText: They were discovered a hundred years ago in an earthquake fissure. Inside each one is an energy core.

data.name: Boldore
data.flavorText: When it overflows with power, the orange crystal on its body glows. It looks for underground water in caves.

data.name: Boldore
data.flavorText: Because its energy was too great to be contained, the energy leaked and formed orange crystals.

data.name: Gigalith
data.flavorText: The solar energy absorbed by its body's orange crystals is magnified internally and fired from its mouth.

data.name: Drilbur
data.flavorText: It can dig through the ground at a speed of 30 mph. It could give a car running aboveground a good race.

data.name: Drilbur
data.flavorText: It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting both claws together and rotating at high speed.

data.name: Excadrill
data.flavorText: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.

data.name: Excadrill
data.flavorText: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.

data.name: Throh
data.flavorText: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts.

data.name: Sawk
data.flavorText: Tying their belts gets them pumped and makes their punches more destructive. Disturbing their training angers them.

data.name: Sandile
data.flavorText: They live buried in the sands of the desert. The sun-warmed sands prevent their body temperature from dropping.

data.name: Krokorok
data.flavorText: They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.

data.name: Krookodile
data.flavorText: They never allow prey to escape. Their jaws are so powerful, they can crush the body of an automobile.

data.name: Terrakion
data.flavorText: This Pokémon came to the defense of Pokémon that had lost their homes in a war among humans.

data.name: Purrloin
data.flavorText: They steal from people for fun, but their victims can't help but forgive them. Their deceptively cute act is perfect.

data.name: Liepard
data.flavorText: These Pokémon vanish and appear unexpectedly. Many Trainers are drawn to their beautiful form and fur.

data.name: Zorua
data.flavorText: It changes into the forms of others to surprise them. Apparently, it often transforms into a silent child.

data.name: Zoroark
data.flavorText: Bonds between these Pokémon are very strong. It protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents.

data.name: Vullaby
data.flavorText: They tend to guard their posteriors with suitable bones they have found. They pursue weak Pokémon.

data.name: Mandibuzz
data.flavorText: Watching from the sky, they swoop to strike weakened Pokémon on the ground. They decorate themselves with bones.

data.name: Ferroseed
data.flavorText: They stick their spikes into cave walls and absorb the minerals they find in the rock.

data.name: Ferroseed
data.flavorText: When threatened, it attacks by shooting a barrage of spikes, which gives it a chance to escape by rolling away.

data.name: Ferrothorn
data.flavorText: They attach themselves to cave ceilings, firing steel spikes at targets passing beneath them.

data.name: Ferrothorn
data.flavorText: It fights by swinging around its three spiky feelers. A hit from these steel spikes can reduce a boulder to rubble.

data.name: Klink
data.flavorText: Interlocking two bodies and spinning around generates the energy they need to live.

data.name: Klang
data.flavorText: Spinning minigears are rotated at high speed and repeatedly fired away. It is dangerous if the gears don't return.

data.name: Klinklang
data.flavorText: The gear with the red core is rotated at high speed for a rapid energy charge.

data.name: Cobalion
data.flavorText: This legendary Pokémon battled against humans to protect Pokémon. Its personality is calm and composed.

data.name: Patrat
data.flavorText: Extremely cautious, they take shifts to maintain a constant watch of their nest. They feel insecure without a lookout.

data.name: Watchog
data.flavorText: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.

data.name: Pidove
data.flavorText: Each follows its Trainer's orders as best it can, but they sometimes fail to understand complicated commands.

data.name: Tranquill
data.flavorText: Many people believe that, deep in the forest where Tranquill live, there is a peaceful place where there is no war.

data.name: Unfezant
data.flavorText: Males have plumage on their heads. They will never let themselves fell close to anyone other than their Trainers.

data.name: Audino
data.flavorText: Its auditory sense is astounding. It has a radar-like ability to understand its surrounding through slight sounds.

data.name: Minccino
data.flavorText: These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat. They are always sweeping and dusting, using their tails as brooms.

data.name: Cinccino
data.flavorText: Their white fur feels amazing to touch. Their fur repels dust and prevents static electricity from building up.

data.name: Rufflet
data.flavorText: They will challenge anything, even strong opponents, without fear. Their frequent fights help them become stronger.

data.name: Rufflet
data.flavorText: They crush berries with their talons. They bravely stand up to any opponent, no matter how strong it is.

data.name: Braviary
data.flavorText: The more scars they have, the more respect these brave soldiers of the sky get from their peers.

data.name: Tornadus
data.flavorText: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.

data.name: Thundurus
data.flavorText: The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.

data.name: Tornadus
data.flavorText: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.
